In-class Exercise 2

Author

Javier Lian

Working with Master Plan 2019 Subzone Boundary Data

  • Tasks
  • Code

  1. Create a sub folder called data in In-class_Ex02 folder

  2. If necessary visit data.gov.sg and download “Master Plan 2024 Subzone Boundary (web)” from the portal. You are required to download the ESRI shapefile and kml file.

  3. Type the code chunk to import the “Master Plan 2024 Subzone Boundary (web)” shapefile and kml file, save them in sf simple features data frame.

::: [style = “fontsize: 1.5em”]

pacman::p_load(sf, tidyverse)

This code chunk imports shape file.

mpsz14_shp <- st_read(
  dsn = "data/geospatial",
  layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL"
)
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `C:\javilian98\IS415-GAA\In-class_Ex\ICE_02\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21

This code chunk imports kml file (error).

class(mpsz14_shp)
[1] "sf"         "data.frame"
#| eval: false
mpsz14_kml <- st_read("data/aspatial/MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML.kml")
Reading layer `MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML' from data source 
  `C:\javilian98\IS415-GAA\In-class_Ex\ICE_02\data\aspatial\MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML.kml' 
  using driver `KML'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84

Method for Resolving MasterPlan2014 kml File Error

st_write(
  mpsz14_shp,
  "data/aspatial/MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML.kml",
  delete_dsn = TRUE
)
Deleting source `data/aspatial/MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML.kml' using driver `KML'
Writing layer `MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML' to data source 
  `data/aspatial/MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML.kml' using driver `KML'
Writing 323 features with 15 fields and geometry type Multi Polygon.

Working with Master Plan 2019 Subzone Boundary Data

  • Task
  • Import Shapefile
  • Import kml

  1. Visit data.gov.sg and download Master Plan 2019 Subzone Boundary (No Sea) from the portal. You are required to download both kml files.

  2. Move MPSZ-2019 shapefile provided for In-Class Exercise 1 folder on elearn to data sub-folder of In-Class_Ex02.

  3. Write a code chunk to import Master Plan 2019 Subzone Boundary (No Sea) kml and MPSZ-2019 into sf simple feature data.frame.

mpsz19_shp <- st_read(
  dsn = "data/geospatial",
  layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL"
)
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `C:\javilian98\IS415-GAA\In-class_Ex\ICE_02\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
mpsz19_kml <- st_read(
  "data/aspatial/MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml"
)
Reading layer `URA_MP19_SUBZONE_NO_SEA_PL' from data source 
  `C:\javilian98\IS415-GAA\In-class_Ex\ICE_02\data\aspatial\MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml' 
  using driver `KML'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY, XYZ
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
  • Import MPSZ-19 Shape
mpsz19_shp <- st_read(
  dsn = "data/geospatial",
  layer = "MPSZ-2019"
) %>%
  st_transform(crs = 3414)
Reading layer `MPSZ-2019' from data source 
  `C:\javilian98\IS415-GAA\In-class_Ex\ICE_02\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 6 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84

Working with Population Data

  • Task
  1. Read the csv data into a variable popdata ### Code
popdata <- read_csv("data/aspatial/respopagesextod2023.csv")
Rows: 100928 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (5): PA, SZ, AG, Sex, TOD
dbl (2): Pop, Time

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

Data Wrangling

  • Task
  • Code
  1. Write a code chunk to prpare a data frame showing population by Planning Area and Planning Subzone.
popdata2023 <- popdata %>%
  group_by(PA, SZ, AG) %>%
  summarise(`POP` = sum(`Pop`)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  pivot_wider(
    names_from = AG,
    values_from = POP
  )
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'PA', 'SZ'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.
colnames(popdata2023)
 [1] "PA"          "SZ"          "0_to_4"      "10_to_14"    "15_to_19"   
 [6] "20_to_24"    "25_to_29"    "30_to_34"    "35_to_39"    "40_to_44"   
[11] "45_to_49"    "50_to_54"    "55_to_59"    "5_to_9"      "60_to_64"   
[16] "65_to_69"    "70_to_74"    "75_to_79"    "80_to_84"    "85_to_89"   
[21] "90_and_Over"

Joining popdata2023 and mpsz19_shp

popdata2023 <- popdata2023 %>%
  mutate_at(
    .vars = vars(PA, SZ), 
    .funs = list(toupper) 
  )
pop2023_mpsz <- left_join(popdata2023, mpsz19_shp, by = c("SZ" = "SUBZONE_N"))
